official-title.#text: To amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to provide for macroeconomic analysis of the impact of legislation.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives April 4, 2014.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part A of title IV of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974

header.#text: Macroeconomic impact analysis of major legislation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, to the extent practicable, prepare for each major bill or resolution reported by any committee of the
or the
(except the
), as a supplement to estimates prepared under
, a macroeconomic impact analysis of the budgetary effects of such bill or resolution for the ten fiscal-year period beginning with the first fiscal year for which an estimate was prepared under
and each of the next three ten fiscal-year periods. The
shall submit to such committee the macroeconomic impact analysis, together with the basis for the analysis. As a supplement to estimates prepared under
, all such information so submitted shall be included in the report accompanying such bill or resolution.

shall describe the potential economic impact of the applicable major bill or resolution on major economic variables, including real gross domestic product, business investment, the capital stock, employment, interest rates, and labor supply. The analysis shall also describe the potential fiscal effects of the bill or resolution, including any estimates of revenue increases or decreases resulting from changes in gross domestic product. To the extent practicable, the analysis should use a variety of economic models in order to reflect the full range of possible economic outcomes resulting from the bill or resolution. The analysis (or a technical appendix to the analysis) shall specify the economic and econometric models used, sources of data, relevant data transformations, and shall include such explanation as is necessary to make the models comprehensible to academic and public policy analysts.
prepared an analysis under
, the
shall report on the accuracy of the original macroeconomic impact analysis of such enacted bill or joint resolution and submit these reports to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on the Budget of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Upon completion of the fifth fiscal year beginning after the date of enactment of any major bill or joint resolution for which the

header.#text: Reporting on accuracy of Macroeconomic impact analyses

text.#text: an estimate of the changes in economic output, employment, interest rates, capital stock, and tax revenues expected to result from enactment of the proposal;
an estimate of revenue feedback expected to result from enactment of the proposal; and
a statement identifying the critical assumptions and the source of data underlying that estimate;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is estimated to be greater than .25 percent of the current projected gross domestic product of the United States for any such fiscal year;

term.#tail: means any bill or resolution if the gross budgetary effects of such bill or resolution for any fiscal year in the period for which an estimate is prepared under
, when applied to a major bill or resolution, means the changes in revenues, outlays, deficits, and debt resulting from that measure; and
means changes in revenue resulting from changes in economic growth as the result of the enactment of any major bill or resolution.

shall be prepared by the
